cards.title: 10 Agents Framework
cards.description: Design and build multi-agent orchestration: Nova (main) + 9 specialized sub-agents. Scouts, executors, analysts. Define roles, communication, and coordination.

cards.title: JTBD Copy Machine
cards.description: Build daily copy generation using Jobs to Be Done framework. For each Alessa product/campaign: identify 5-10 jobs customers hire it for, generate ad copy/hooks for each job. Can be an agent or daily cron task.

cards.title: Nova Life OS: Dashboard
cards.description: Web UI showing knowledge graph, today's notes, tasks, calendar, upcoming. Serve from Mac mini, access from any device. The command center.

cards.title: AI Influencer Agent
cards.description: Specialized agent for AI influencer content: prompts, personas, captions, content calendars. Path 1: content planner now, upgrade when image gen API solved. Path 2: API first, then full agent.

cards.title: Nova Life OS: Backlink Engine
cards.description: Auto-detect mentions of people/companies/projects in notes and create backlinks. When I write about someone, it links to their entity file.

cards.title: Balaji PPP Stack
cards.description: Personal Private Programmable stack: Claude Code + Obsidian + local wallet. AI on encrypted local data. The redecentralization thesis. Build the life OS layer.

cards.title: Nova Life OS: Graph View
cards.description: Visual map of how entities connect — who knows who, projects to people, investments to thesis. Interactive, zoomable.

cards.title: Nova Life OS: Search API
cards.description: Instant semantic search across all memory files. Already have embeddings — build the query interface + expose via dashboard.

cards.title: Nova Life OS: Mobile Quick Capture
cards.description: Telegram command to quickly add notes, tasks, ideas. Parse intent and route to right place (memory, kanban, entity file).

cards.title: AI Trading Agent (Grok)
cards.description: Use Grok for market analysis + build execution layer. Components: (1) Grok via browser/API for trade signals, (2) Market data feed, (3) Brokerage API (Alpaca/IBKR), (4) Situational awareness prompting. Start with paper trading to validate edge.

cards.title: Polymarket Trading Bot
cards.description: Automated prediction market trading on Polymarket. Components: (1) Event scanning + edge detection, (2) Polymarket API integration, (3) Position sizing + risk management, (4) AI analysis for probability assessment. Good testbed for AI trading — simpler than stocks, binary outcomes.

cards.title: AgentMail: Dedicated email inbox for Nova
cards.description: Evaluate AgentMail (YC S25) for giving Nova a dedicated email address. Benefits: 2FA automation, safer than riding on personal Gmail (users reported bans), purpose-built for agents. URL: agentmail.to

cards.title: Image Gen Sub-Agent (Nano Banana Pro)
cards.description: Build sub-agent for image generation. Blocker: Enable Google Cloud billing for Gemini API access to Nano Banana/Imagen. Alternative: browser automation on Higgsfield (slower).

cards.title: Agentic SEO for Alessa
cards.description:
Optimize Alessa for AI agents, not just humans.

When someone asks Claude or ChatGPT "find me a cocktail dress under €100 in Bulgaria," Alessa should surface.

Key tactics:
• Structured data (schema markup)
• Clear product attributes in content
• Being in knowledge bases AI pulls from
• Natural language product descriptions (not just keyword stuffing)

The 300 product descriptions we wrote are already a head start - benefit-focused, natural language.

cards.title: Polymarket Arbitrage Bot
cards.description:
Build automated trading bot for Polymarket prediction markets.

**Strategies to implement:**
1. Sum-to-one arbitrage (YES + NO < $1)
2. Latency arbitrage (Binance/Coinbase price → Polymarket lag)
3. Cross-platform arb (Polymarket ↔ Kalshi)

**Tech stack:**
- Python + py_clob_client
- WebSocket for real-time orderbook
- Polygon wallet + USDC
- Low-latency VPS (Amsterdam/NYC)

**Resources:**
- pmxt library (unified API wrapper)
- Open source bot: github.com/realfishsam/prediction-market-arbitrage-bot
- QuantJourney Python framework

**Starting capital:** $500-5K
**Target:** 10-50% monthly returns

**Phase 1:** Run existing open-source bot in dry-run
**Phase 2:** Go live with $100-500
**Phase 3:** Scale + add latency arb

cards.title: Evaluate upgrade from clawdbot → openclaw (side-by-side) to enable Opus 4.6
cards.description: Someday: assess risks/benefits of switching from npm package clawdbot (2026.1.24-3) to openclaw (currently 2026.2.3-1). Goal: Opus 4.6 allowlist + improvements. Do NOT do now; plan: backup config, install side-by-side, verify gateway status, migrate if safe.
